messages.content: Disappointed you never shared your thoughts.

share.share_text:
Splendid lunch, thatâs not doing it justice truthfully, @eusebi_deli yesterday. A cornucopia of delectable Italian deliciousness. Burrata, so creamy, with beetroot purÃ©e and blood oranges right up my strada. Great chunks of focaccia anointed in rosemary oil perfect for fare la scarpetta. 
Little treats of cacio pepe lasagne fritto, eggs diavoletta (could eat these to a band playing) and crostini
arrived unexpectedly, thank you from the bottom of my tummy @giovannaeusebi - each a taste bomb.
Our lunch host, mother-in-law Thelma, devoured her whole roasted sea bass. Debbie waxed lyrical over her prawn linguine as I immersed myself in beef pappardelle worthy of Caesar himself. 
We could have stopped there but youâve seen the cake cabinet in @eusebi_deli ? Caramel eclair, fluffy passion fruit cheesecake and a lemon meringue pie later we waddled back to the car only for me to fill it with unleaded instead of diesel, thatâs another story.

messages.content: I will attempt it next time.
How did u cook them? In the oven?
Mind you, I burnt, beyond edible, the first batch as I was distracted by my grandchildren.

Alfie, my second youngest grandson, was over helping me with the Sicilian salsiccia production this afternoon.  Thank you @ignazio_polito for your family recipe and @thomsonbrosbutchers for the excellent pork belly and shoulder needed. 
@marinagpoloughlin young Alfie wonders what you would make of his sausage.

messages.content: Well whoever didn't go missed a treat. My partner thoroughly enjoyed herself
Iâm delighted you enjoyed the experience. Currently working out the finances, sadly very little profit, who knows whatâs next?
Brilliant, I've not had time to post anything yet. Great meal. U going to do another?
U might need to bring the heavies in. Bodyguard required lol

share.share_text: https://ig.me/j/AbY00Gmto95O6LAY/

Iâm generally a harsh critic of shop bought filled pastas, however, my dear friend #pierosarti smuggled these past merciless Brexit border guards at various customsâ posts in order that I might have my eyes opened. Pork and veal ragu and @parmigianoreggiano from my fridge brought this bowlful to a deliciously dazzling finale. I would eat this again, and again. #tordellolucchese

Sunday Roast could not be any better. Stunning dry aged four rib joint from @carters_butchers in #bamburgh 
Thank you #mickcarter astounding quality, and I cooked it in 65 minutesâ¦not bad considering it weighed about 5kgâ¦ Canât wait to get back down to Dukesfield and #bamburgh first. @simon_mtp
Langoustines, fresh from the West Coast via @wilsonscatchoftheday straddling this steaming mound of spaghettini al pomodoro e origano selvatico siciliano, so good it hurts.

@motherindiascafe___ on dazzling form!!!! The freshest vegetable pakora and spicy keema dosa, perfect introduction to a stupendous feast. Tamarind monkfish, saag paneer, cauliflower and potatoes, lamb rogan josh, lamb mince with peas, chicken tikka makhni, prawn achari, spiced prawns, Dhal, fried rice, lemon and cashew rice, chapatis and a single nougat to finishâ¦ 
Never, ever disappoints.

Pure comfort âteaâ. 
Cannae beat an old fashioned #prawncocktail followed by #fishandchips 
Great slabs of the freshest #angelcuthaddock - the first catch of 2023, in fresh breadcrumbs partnered by those golden #chips cut by hand from @lidlgb #bakingpotatoes - just being a lazy fud, less peeling and longer chips!!! Sides? #peas and a wee bowl of homemade #breadedscampi 
We were so stuffed we had to wait for a couple of hours before we tackled the mixed fruit crumble and cream. By which time I couldnât be arsed to take any pictures. Let me assure you that the apple, pear, plum, passion fruit, golden kiwi, raspberry and blueberry combination soaked in cognac and vanilla bubbling under that sweet crumbly topping did not let the team down. Thereâs some left, breakfast?, maybe get a shot in then ð

#shoplocal #alanbeveridge #giffnock

âTis the season to be merry. After this astonishing feast from @officialmotherindia I was grinning from ear to ear.
A sublime meal from #vegetablepakora through to my #pokeyhat 
 I phoned big boss #monir to arrange whole roast chicken(s) and #keemapeas what a move that turned out to be, awesome performance by the kitchen along with exemplary service from the foh team. 
 
We ate like royalty, our friends Paul & Audrey Stevenson (@paesanopizzaglasgow & @sugopastaglasgow ) were blown away. Iâve been nagging them for eons to join us thereâ¦

#spinach #blackdahl and puffy #nanbread filled all the gaps.

The Mother India collection of restaurants @officialmotherindia @motherindiascafe___ @lansdowneglasgow serve astoundingly good food.

Not a single gram of meat was involved in todayâs lunchâ¦
@beyondmeat made, with a little help from me and some of the #usualsuspects , a #ragu of depth and intensity of taste. Even surprised me!!! @muttipomodoroit @mutti_france @muttipomodorouk @barilla 
Couldnât resist making a handful of #chips to sprinkle with @maldonsalt 
Continuing the meatless mouthfuls, fried @tildarice #brownbasmatirice #quinoa and #tofu before some #rhubarbtart with @coconutcollab #custard

I love fish cakes, especially made with poached #scotchsalmon combined with #hotsmokedsalmon 
A wee side of an interesting Middle Eastern salad: sweet potato, quinoa and walnuts and pickled cucumber strips, deelishusss!!!
If you start with exceptional ingredients youâre more than halfway there.
Another perfect Italian immersion experience @eusebi_deli today. Thank you @giovannaeusebi the food and service from you and your staff were sublime.

One splendid afternoon. My old chum #simonmallinson @simon_mtp from @mtp_scotland invited me for a sumptuous luncheon in @eusebi_deli 
What a swell party it was!!! @giovannaeusebi your team surpassed themselves. Homemade #octopussalami dressed in #capers and #anchovies, #courgettefries and #aioli, #sourdoughfocaccia, #oxtonguetonnato and the creamiest #burrata with those #pressedpeaches - bliss. How do they press peaches? Sit on them or in a vacuum pouch? We shared stunning #agnolotti with #Pecorino and #honey and #linguineallevongole 
When you next visit, the #cherrycheesecake with #pistacchio must be tried!!!
@giovannaeusebi thank you for making an old man happy. @simon_mtp demonstrating his ability to light a picture.
Italian food fans, all food fans, this is a remarkable little part of Italy, alive and flourishing, in Glasgowâs West End. Favaloso.
Spaghettini, salsiccia piccante fatta in casa e salsa di pomodoro San marzano, i campi dell'Ayrshire sullo sfondo.

Rarely do I come across a venue which in one visit thrusts itself onto my list of favourites. @lansdowneglasgow did just that yesterday, on the first dry and sunny Fair Saturday in living memory.
Monir (Mr Mother India) had been telling me to get in there for some time but life kept getting in the way.
Finally, yesterday we made it. Welcomed with more enthusiasm than the prodigal son, by a fantastic front of house team and gifted head chef @sharma175201 we happily agreed to chefâs suggestion that he chose a selection of dishes for us. 

WOW WOW WOW. 

A La Carte, Street Food and Saturday set lunch menus morphed into one.

Cauliflower pakora, broccoli pakora, fish pakora and chicken pakora, impeccably prepared, are served with tamarind and coriander chutneys. Iâm told that the cauliflower comes with a slightly heavier batter else it get a little oily. Whatever, they were dynamite!!!

Poppadoms, dry and crisp, maybe the best Iâve had, were served with onions, mango chutney and more tamarind and coriander chutneys.

Next up, two plates of typical street food, Aloo Tikki - wonderful potato dish and Dahi Bhalla - lentil dumplings dressed in yoghurt and pomegranate seeds. These were ridiculously good.

Cocktail sized vegetable samosas were put down in front of us, with more of the tamarind and coriander chutneys, thank God we havenât had any breakfast!!!

Time for the main coursesâ¦ð

Moist and succulent chicken tikka done three ways, on a sizzling plate loaded with sweet fried onions, a delicious curry gravy served separately and a variety of the lightest and fluffiest breads this side of the Ganges! Peshwari and garlic & coriander nans as well a vegetable stuffed paratha fought for space on the table alongside basmati rice done two ways. Colourful salads, a beautiful backdrop to the immense king prawn curry.

We were so stuffed, we had actually used our dessert tummies as well by this point, no pudding space left  and what we hadnât finished was packed into containers for us to take home.

We just could not eat dinner, our son-in-law @theoriginalgreganory messaged this morning thanking us for the âbest ever takeaway leftoversâ heâs had.

Says it allâ¦

After 30 hours in a sous vide this #brisket was #pink #moist and #perfect 
#saltbeef #pickledbrisket #scotchbeef
Frittata loaded with sweet onions, mini Swedish sausages and tons of cheese. So good I ate the entire thingâ¦

Met up with #teamlivingwell in @chinatown.gla @jonesthetrainer @paul_fitzp @cameronlobo25 for another sensational feast before flying solo to @ilgelatodipiero for a kaleidoscope of fabulous fruit sorbets. 
I just need to sleep.

What a delight this feast was to munch.

Got this from @hrcglasgow 

This was the.....

SMOKEHOUSE BBQ COMBO
Choose from slow-cooked Baby Back Ribs, Barbecue Chicken, or hand-pulled smoked pork served with our house-made barbecue sauce. The perfect combination of our smokehouse specialties, served with seasoned fries, coleslaw and ranch-style beans.

And 

HOMEMADE APPLE COBBLER
Old-fashioned apple cobbler with warm Granny Smith apples, baked until golden brown and topped with vanilla bean ice cream and caramel sauce.

That apple cobbler was a great dessert. There's always room :) 

I ate that chicken leg first then butchered my way through the ribs. You need plenty of napkins.

I would recommend it.

Fatherâs Day lunch @thesorninn really was a treat.  A wee trip down to East Ayrshire on a sunny, albeit blustery, day was an ideal way of clearing the cobwebs out of the system. From the warmest of welcomes until we left the staff were terrific. Great food, impressive kidsâ menu too. Thank you @carlyjshear for inviting us.  It was a magical afternoon, just a pity we couldnât gather the entire clan. 
Iâve been coming here on occasion for over 40 years, in fact my last visit a few years back was in the company of @coxusa when someone mistook him for Albert Finney!!!

Not sure if Iâm meant to be feeding or starving this long running chest infection so I opted for the former. Outstanding, as ever, supper in @officialmotherindia #cafe from the welcome, service, food, company and the devilishly roguish smiles from some of the pictures on the walls -  it was perfect!!!! Thank you @therealtamcowan @phildiffercomedy #charlesmarks #monirmohammed and all the staff for their undivided attention. Have I mention that #wholeroastchicken #pakora and #roadsidelamb ??? Wow!!!

Love a surprise lunch. Thank you @ronaldodelduca and #jimstevenson for the delicious food and entertaining and enlightening chat which put a huge smile on my face despite suffering from tonsillitis. #saltandchillitofu #saltandchilliribs #ribsincapitalsauce #kingprawncurry #extrahot #chickencurry #onionrings #specialorder #mandarincheesecake #howongglasgow

Local corn fed chickens smothered in a pimento and garlic paste before roasting. Canary Island potatoes, padron peppers and coriander added to the roasting pan before magically transforming into savoury, sticky goodness. 
Sweet and aromatic strawberries, from a local grower, and a fruit jelly finished us off. 
Considering I was in A&E at midnight last night with suspected DVT I think itâs been a damn fine alternative to hospital nosh.

Easter Monday lunch. Trip to my local deli and butcher and I was set.  I never tire of #mammaantoniastottscaponata thank you for sharing the recipe #kenstott 
The lamb shoulder in lamb broth was a bit special too. Did I mention the salted pavlova roulade bursting at the seams with raspberries and pomegranate in a wee swally dressing? 
Hope your Easter was as mouthwatering as mine.

Slow roasted bone in lamb shoulder.
Inexpensive and delicious. I simply roasted this joint with the seasonings I had to hand, there is no hard and fast rule. If you want to add heat, use chillies, or for a more aromatic roast whatever herbs and spices are in your kitchen. 
Serve with roast or buttered potatoes, rice or flatbreads.
Serves 4 - 6.
Ingredients:
* 2.5kg lamb shoulder (bone-in).
* splash of extra virgin olive oil.
*  300ml vegetable/lamb/chicken stock (substitute water).
* 1 whole head of garlic, split in half through the cloves.
* 2 large onions, quartered.
* 3 carrots cut into large chunks.
* 2 tablespoons runny honey
* 3 tablespoons mint sauce. 
* 10 thin slices of pancetta
* Salt flakes & freshly ground pepper.
Method:
* Preheat the oven to 200Â°C. 
* Remove the rib bones from the lamb, reserving them for later.
* Heat your roasting pan over a high heat on your hob. Sear lamb, skin side down, in the dry pan then once nicely coloured turn over and sear the other side. remove from the tray.
* Put stock, garlic, carrots and onions in your roasting tray.
* Season lamb with salt and pepper on both sides. Put the ribs into the tray to act as a trivet. Place lamb, skin side up, on the ribs. Baste with olive oil, honey and mint sauce then cover with the pancetta.
* Put uncovered into the oven 20 minutes. 
* Turn the oven down to 140C, seal the tray with tinfoil and put back into the oven for 3 hours by which time the lamb should be fully cooked and tender. If not, pop it back in until itâs as you like.
* Remove the lamb from the tray and set aside, loosely covered with tinfoil, to rest for at least 15 minutes.
* Blitz the vegetables and add back to the stock. Make a roux with butter and flour and stir though your stock, mixing well. You can add a teaspoon or two of gravy browning if you like a darker gravy.
* If the gravy is too thick add a little liquid to loosen, check the seasoning and adjust to taste.
* Finally strain the gravy through a fine sieve, using the back of a wooden spoon squash out any lumps.
Serve with your choice of rice, potatoes or breads as well as a crisp green salad, tzatziki, and some roast fennel or any other vegetables you like.

Delicious with or without the truffle mash. Some buttered #jerseyroyals or #roastpotatoes will hit the spot. 

If you donât have a sous vide then in a conventional oven 200Â°C/Fan180Â°C/Gas mark 6

2kg bone-in leg of lamb, studded with garlic and rosemary then well rubbed with butter.

Place the lamb in a roasting tin, cover loosely with foil and place in the preheated oven. After 30 minutes, remove the foil and leave to roast for a further 50â60 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Remove the lamb from the oven and leave to rest for 10â15 minutes, with some foil on top to keep it warm. Make a gravy with the pan juices or good lamb stock cubes.
Itâs been a while since Iâve cooked a leg of lamb or âgigotâ as the #French  and #Scots call it. I was delighted when the boys, I use that term with poetic license, gave me one to prepare.  Iâm a great believer in simplicity so #evoo #rosemary #garlic #salt and #pepper  were the only other flavourings I wanted. I cooked mine by the #sousvide method, 24 hours @ 55Â°C followed by 15 minutes in a hot (240Â°C) oven. It was as tender as a #marshmallow with such delicate flavour. I served it with #blacktrufflemash and #roastasparagus bathed in #lemonbutter My #gigot was bone in but @thomsonbrosbutchers will bone and roll it for you on request. You could opt for the oven roast method if you donât have access to a sous vide. #Lamb is great value right now, what are you waiting for?????
Sunday dinner. Stuffed. Bed.

16 inch cha chas special pizza - spicy chicken, spicy mince, onion, peppers, mushroom and sweetcorn.

Absolutely fantastic. I asked for extra cheese as well cos you know lol

You could feed a family of 4 with this ð¤¤ð¤¤

Unscheduled solo visit to @pickledgingerfinnieston and it was a stoater. 
Helpful staff making light of the fact that my entrance was marred by me knocking a glass candleholder off the next table with my fat ass only for it to smash into a thousand piecesâ¦.ooops, sorry.
Happy to modify my choices, I had spicy chicken with fried rice and tempura prawn maki (not on the menu). Both of these were terrific.
Earlier I had been turned away from @gloriosa_glasgow as they were unable to take walk-in customers due to staff shortages in the kitchen. Another night maybe.
I had a thoroughly delightful supper, thank you.

The quarter pounder with cheese meal. A staple diet for some people lol

Is this McDonald's best burger?

Sirloin, boiled potatoes and asparagus, thatâs yer tea.  Smashing.

Iâm easily led, especially when it concerns eatingâ¦ Earlier today, I saw @marinagpoloughlin had posted a picture of an irresistible sausage and dripping fried egg muffin. Really, a muffin, not a crisp @mortonsrolls but the wee delivery van doesnât travel that far south. 
Iâm wandering here so back to the point.
I have @thomsonbrosbutchers finest pork links in my fridge and a dozen eggs from my daughterâs @carlyjshear and son-in-lawâs @theoriginalgreganory neighbour who happens to be a farmer in #tarbolton 
I took my dogs for their morning walk through the park planning my own version of the sausage and egg fiesta. Pop into #netherlee  #postoffice on my way home to collect the âproperâ rolls, none of yer cooncil muffins for this lad, get them well spread with the magnificent @isignystemere unpasteurised salted butter before loading them with the oh so slowly cooked links and #sunnysideup egg liberally sprinkled with @blackthornsalt and @kamlaekampotpepper before demolishing the entire structure in three gigantic bites and silently thanking Ms OâLoughlin for leading me on this gastronomic folly.
Alas, I had completely forgotten my arrangement with @ronaldodelduca to go down to his home gym in an effort to kick start my necessary and long overdue journey back to fitnessâ¦ 30 minutes, or so Ronaldo assured me it was - felt like two hours, later I staggered into my car, thighs unable to operate without assistance and drove straight home, without collecting rolls. Somehow the âdoublerâ had lost its allure. I opened a tin of @tonnocallipo and prepared a healthy tuna mayo topping for my bread. Finely diced onions, chopped new green pickled cucumber, diced balsamic onions, finely chopped birdseye red chilli, parsley, @hellmannsmayonnaise salt & pepper. It was delicious, ok., not maybe as delicious but a fraction of the calories and it meant I could have a wee lime & raspberry jelly with half a roast #nectarine in the middle. 
My thighs are feeling the burn for sure!

Amongst the many phenomena to be thrust into the public gaze during two years + of lockdown and isolation were the nationâs fascination with banana bread, sour dough starters and the foraging of wild garlic. 
Banana bread gives me the boak and I find those who bake it a little âmumsyâ. Sour dough fanatics, with their little jars of living proof that we are not alone, are generally not high on my list of desert island companions.
Wild garlic however, once rinsed of dogsâ pee, gives me a day frolicking around in front of the stove. Chicken, noodle, shiitake mushrooms and saffron soup and a batch of wild garlic and fennel sausage my rewards. 
I think in the UK there should be a Wild Garlic Feast Day, similar to the truffle, artichoke etc., etc., festivals celebrated by those fortunate enough to still be part of Europe.

Thinking back to my last visit to @boroughmarket  and the amazing @turnipsborough @fredturnip 
If only all food markets were this good. For the record, that violet garlic is the stuff of my dreams.

Birthday dinner for my son-in-law @theoriginalgreganory 
In @ladragonkilmarnock 
We had a really calm and relaxed dinner with 2 year old #sid & his big brother #finn whoâs nearly 5 ð In fairness, it was their father who smashed the @sanpellegrino_official glass water bottle. Delicious food as usual, our mixed starter plates full of ribs, prawns and dumplings were excellent as were the crispy fried beef and extra hot chicken curry. Thank you @carlyjshear for the treat. p.s. Loved the (not pictured) @marksandspencer #victoriasponge birthday cakeâ¦

messages.content: I would go back although they served penne with a chicken and cream sauce ffs!!!

Fantastic hospitality, delicious treats, @carrarocoffeeuk coffee and drinks straight from #fortknox laden with 24ct gold, incredible juggling display by #Burman the cocktail king, the amazingly gifted singing @thelogansworld and a catch-up with @glasgowfoodelicious 
Intimate, welcoming and honest, as well as ideal when catching a show @kingsandroyalglasgow 
We will be back for sure.

I think this is the best Chinese takeaway that serves BishopBriggs.

Ordered this chicken chow mein and some salt n chilli chicken balls and it was delicious. They didnt hold back on the portion size either.

The holy grail of pancakes! And yes they tasted as good as they looked. Omg! 

So me and my bro popped into stack and still in braehead and got this feast. Its pancake Tuesday today so i thought i would share and give out some inspiration.

Who would have thought pulled pork tasted amazong on pancakes? Btw you can customise your own ones. I was toying with the idea of putting bacon on the strawberry Cheesecake Stack but my bro wasnt impressed lol 

Anyone else been or planning on it? 

Heres what we shared.

Strawberry Cheesecake Stack

Buttermilk Stack, Strawberries, Meringue,  Cream Cheese, Biscuit Crumb, Toffee Sauce, Chocolate Sauce.

Chipotle Pulled Pork Stack

Buttermilk Stack, Slow Cooked Chipotle & BBQ Pork, Avocado, Chickpea Salsa, Chipotle Mayo, Tortilla Chips, Coriander.

MONSTER SHAKE!
Tropical Mango & Raspberry Smoothie

Exotic Fruit Smoothie topped with Lemon Curd, Coconut, Raspberries, 
Skittles, Mango & Raspberry Ice Cream & Raspberry Syrup

We also got cajun seasoning on the fries and onion rings we got on the side.

.
.
.
.
.

They currently have a deal that ends tomorrow Â£50 for a cake and topper like that cake so if ur looking or have a sweet tooth get ordering its some deal.

How lucky am I? One birthday gift voucher and Iâm back within a week at the @howong for dinner. Yuk sung, king prawns with salad cream, butterfly king prawns, salt and chilli ribs, beef fillet & broccoli with teriyaki sauce, Szechuan king prawns and lychees and ice cream. 
Iâve still got another voucher left!!!

Returning like a roaring lion, reasserting his rightful place as leader of the pack, the #howongglasgow is undoubtedly back in business. 
Where else for this reunion of rugged ragged rascals? Quite how everyone in the picture looks unchanged from our last gathering 2 years ago, apart from fat bastard me, is a mystery. 
I think theyâve all had #bawtox. 
Set lunch menu today had us eating meaty ribs done two ways, chicken satay, chicken curry, beef chow mein, salt & chilli chicken, sweet and sour chicken and lychees and ice cream. Nothing out of the ordinary you may think but they just do it so well.
Licking my lips in anticipation of the a la carte. #teamhowong

Happy birthday to meâ¦ Out with the boys, celebrating my coming of age. 
@loboglasgow is our destination, I was here a couple of weeks ago with @clairirwin_photography and been planning my return ever since. Outside, the wind and rain would strip the flesh from your cheeks within seconds if left exposed. Inside, an oasis of warmth, laughter, delicious aromas and relaxing âhiâs.â
We asked for double portions of each plate ordered, there were five of usâ¦
In random order, focaccia draped in roast peppers, braised leeks, harissa lamb, gnocchi and mushrooms, cannelloni beans, croquettes filled with blue cheese, cauliflower, chicken thighs in a sticky agro dolce dressing, Basque cheesecake (didnât know the little Basquers ate cheesecake) and a plum and frangipani tart. 
As I had suggested the venue I was more than relieved listening to appreciative grunts coming from my chums. 
The friendliest and most charming of servers was a bonus. Astounding eyebrows.
For casual dining on Glasgowâs Southside I cannot think of a better venue.

Something about it being pizza day or something? Lol its pizza day every f*kn day! 

Get one with donner meat, spicy chicken, onions and pepperoni and whatever else is on this bad boy and thank me later. 

Dont forget the chilli/kebab sauce.

share.share_text:
Lunch with a couple of legendsâ¦ 
Instruction in the art of pakora making followed closely with a delectable keema and peas cradling a lusciously moist and tender lamb shank, raita and wholemeal chapatis, raise your eyes to heaven. What else to be doing on a cold Tuesday afternoon in February?
HUGE thanks to #monirmohammed for having me to his home, sharing his recipe, astounding food and impeccable hospitality. To my fellow diner #Tomshields your company and charm sealed the deal. 
@officialmotherindia @theheraldscotland

If your wondering what you should be eating today after a mental weekend then its this!

share.share_text:
Where do I start? With the deliciously warming spiced lentil and carrot soup I can almost hear @therealtamcowan groaning. âDo you pronounce it choritho or chorizzo?â he enquires. For the record itâs âthâ the correct way!!! Heâs having the choriTHO and kale broth.

Our original plans disrupted and devastated by folk having well deserved breaks at @lochfynerestaurants and  @inverrestaurant damn nerve of some people.
We decided to kick off with a late lunch at the wonderful @gloagburn then see where the road leads us after. 

Soups finished, both cracking, I was a little jealous when I saw Tamâs club sandwich, packed tighter than a Westminster party during lockdown. In fact, after heâd finished he looked like an over efficient fluffer on a porn movie set. ð When my ham hough and potato salad was put down in front of me, I only had eyes for that, excellent. 

Hands up if youâve ever felt like a wee roll and links after your main course. ðð¼ââï¸ðð¼ââï¸ðð¼ââï¸ Our super server, friendly, informative and exceptionally competent - Iâm sorry I never got her name - arranged an after hours breakfast treat to line my stomach before I ate both mine and my chauffeurâs desserts, vanilla and raspberry cheesecake and a cream and fruit filled meringue.

Where next? The East Neuk and the famous @anstrutherfishbar in fairness we didnât have chipsâ¦ Tam had the superb battered haddock and as recommended by the wonderful Tania I had local prawns in batter.  What a way to finishâ¦

All that was left after our visit to these great institutions was the drive home, the bloody long way, listening to Tamâs personal playlist. Tom Jones, Bing Crosby, Aretha Franklin and yes even Sydney Devine all giving it laldy but when the themes from Crossroads and Jimâll Fix It damaged the speakers and my sanity I was ready to be institutionalised.

Road trip today with @therealtamcowan 
 Heading towards @lochfynerestaurants @deliatlochfyne for a healthy and delicious lunch but theyâre on a winter break!!! Change of venue to the incredibly inspired @inverrestaurant but they too are taking a well deserved rest.  Any suggestions? Iâve not seen Tam since June â21, after we were invited to @10downingstreet #workevents on different nights during lockdown and still to compare the generous #partybags received. In preparation of todayâs epic journey I made myself a #specialfishsupper  minted #mushypeas and Chippie #pickledonions Can anywhere match my plateful? @anstrutherfishbar @thegleneagleshotel @gloagburn

It doesnât have to be turkey. Molasses and black treacle glaze, simple, sensational and festive. If your Christmas lunch booking has to be cancelled because of you know what and you canât get a turkey this late onâ¦ your local butcher will probably be able to fix you up with a gammon joint, more than a match for any gobbler.
